revisions:
[{'created': '2017-03-26 17:52:56.000000000', 'message': "Use tmp env path when rewriting absolute resource paths

When rewriting absolute resource paths from a resource_registry that
failed to load due to missing resources (one case being where those
resources are rendered j2), then we should refer to the initial
environemnt that failed to load by the tmp path.

This is required since itself may have been rendered from j2. In such a
case, the environment doesn't exist under the absolute template root
path as it's not been rendered to that location.

Change-Id: Ib681729cc2728ca4b0486c14166b6b702edfcaab
Closes-Bug: #1671096
(cherry picked from commit 9bfd6c21a7648e945576ce025ecc8e7733bee93c)
"}]
commit_message:
Use tmp env path when rewriting absolute resource paths

When rewriting absolute resource paths from a resource_registry that
failed to load due to missing resources (one case being where those
resources are rendered j2), then we should refer to the initial
environemnt that failed to load by the tmp path.

This is required since itself may have been rendered from j2. In such a
case, the environment doesn't exist under the absolute template root
path as it's not been rendered to that location.

Change-Id: Ib681729cc2728ca4b0486c14166b6b702edfcaab
Closes-Bug: #1671096
(cherry picked from commit 9bfd6c21a7648e945576ce025ecc8e7733bee93c)

commit_message:
Fix batch delete key pairs button isn't disabled when the key pair has deleted

When the key pair has deleted by the batch delete button, the batch
delete button isn't disabled and still can be clicked.

Since whatever in the keypairs panel or on key pair details page,
After the key pair is deleted, the url will be redirected to the
key pairs panel. The correct way is that only the key pair is deleted
on the details page, and it needs to be redirected to the key pairs
panel.

Change-Id: Ie3041cc70bde84e9753be41f0a80d04534ffdf44
Closes-Bug:#1739871

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-04-12 18:23:26.000000000', 'message': '[WIP] add local mirrors and cache image

This is an image I have been working on to cache distro packages as
well as pip packages. Its still pretty rough, but is a huge bandwidth
saver not to mention a speed boost.

Additionally, it has a git cloner and server built in so it mirrors the
gits for the container clone which is desired.

Running this as --net=host isnt strictly required, but all the configs
are pinned to 17.17.0.1, so the built-in config files would need to
change to support non net=host deploys.

port 3140: git
port 3141: pypi
port 3142: apt/rpm

Change-Id: I76e1d5fdc5e7c982c3fa77e3f46c069daa5b939f
'}]
commit_message:
[WIP] add local mirrors and cache image

This is an image I have been working on to cache distro packages as
well as pip packages. Its still pretty rough, but is a huge bandwidth
saver not to mention a speed boost.

Additionally, it has a git cloner and server built in so it mirrors the
gits for the container clone which is desired.

Running this as --net=host isnt strictly required, but all the configs
are pinned to 17.17.0.1, so the built-in config files would need to
change to support non net=host deploys.

port 3140: git
port 3141: pypi
port 3142: apt/rpm

Change-Id: I76e1d5fdc5e7c982c3fa77e3f46c069daa5b939f

commit_message:
Make ignore wheels that exist natively whl upstream optional

This allows building of older openstack versions (eg Newton) and
also provides a mechanism for building offline simply.

Change-Id: I34ae649d2cfd205b01f5460bef846ec70aad460d

commit_message:
Normalize package installs and networking for AIO

The bootstrap-host role has a ton of skipped tasks that cause delays
in the gate jobs. This patch allows us to do a dynamic include and
only run the tasks that are needed for each distribution.

Change-Id: I783cdcd2223d8eca574f8f1d30e18d76e5710dac

commit_message:
Fail stack action on unexpected resource plugin exception

Handle construct_input_data() exceptions to avoid a stack being stuck
in-progress if convergence is turned on and a resource plugin has a
bug in the attribute resolution code.

Change-Id: I16a1be6ac8e93462de227a0490b11cd96d0cb337

commit_message:
Split long lines

Use textwrap to they are split on word boundaries.  400 characters
is used as an approximation of a safe line length without dealing
with the complexity of determining the exact value for specific
conditions.  In practice, we've seen lines truncated at 435 chars.

We sleep between issuing chunks, however, we sleep less than the
normal flood protection interval so the bot still appears responsive.

Change-Id: I87d26228f0e025d911b29a1662a069a2b6d0e497

Remove cloudwatch haproxy configuration

This ensures the cloudwatch configuration is removed before
running the role.

commit_message:
Cyborg Nova interaction take 2

Dramatically revised from this

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/448228/3/specs/proposal/cyborg-nova-interaction.rst

My goal with this spec is to have it be only where we interact with nova without
details of other components, otherwise we just get into a monolithic spec for
everything.

I plan to expand this into exact api calls and a detailed workflow, especially
for the new API call we will have to make in nova to register whitelisted
devices live.  That being said we may need to reboot the machine to change the
grub config anyways so maybe we should be looking at how to make that work
first.

Change-Id: I22037109b613d7b33d7c620b78493ec7e96e735e

commit_message:
Define and assign capsule status

Due to the requirements to integrate with k8s, we define capsule's
status according to k8s pod's 'phases'. In particular, there
are following statuses:
* Pending: one or more containers are pending on creation
* Running: all containers are created and at least one of them
  is starting or running.
* Succeeded: all containers has terminated with success state.
* Failed: all containers are terminated and at least one container
  exists with failed state.
* Unknown: the states of containers cannot be obtained.

Co-Authored-By: Kevin Zhao <kevin.zhao@arm.com>

Change-Id: Id348a464e78a5fdbfb41aa8f87421ca36ee728e6

commit_message:
Fix test_create_update tests failed sometimes raise Timeout error

test_create_update tests failed sometimes raise Timeout error,
debug the rootcause is due to update processed within a second,
so the stack_identifier's update_time will equal with the
stack's update_time, so it can not jump out of the loop,
will cause the timeout error
https://github.com/openstack/heat/blob/master/heat_integrationtests/common/test.py#L310-L311

This patch add a one second sleep to avoid this.

Closes-bug: #1745276
Change-Id: I0e1f9ea9b45130d19519d5de9ffc71eaecc67f06

[{'created': '2018-02-26 14:22:25.000000000', 'message': "Zaqar: Bind to IP, not proxied host

Zaqar's websocket endpoint is binding to the proxied hostname instead of
the actual IP that the service should be listening on. This is not
correct as that interface is used by HAProxy.

Change-Id: I3e528ef072a8d21984e4d4b05b41de99be5b1d0d
Closes-Bug: #1751779
"}]
commit_message:
Zaqar: Bind to IP, not proxied host

Zaqar's websocket endpoint is binding to the proxied hostname instead of
the actual IP that the service should be listening on. This is not
correct as that interface is used by HAProxy.

Change-Id: I3e528ef072a8d21984e4d4b05b41de99be5b1d0d
Closes-Bug: #1751779

commit_message:
Remove unused status related fields

The action and the status_reason fields are not used in the latest
state-machine. This patch stops showing these unused fields.

Partially Implements: blueprint state-machine

Change-Id: I14e7e2c545c37f215c0303d6906748f4d5a120ab

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-23 14:46:50.000000000', 'message': 'Skip logging for haproxy health checks

The health check requests from haproxy cause uwsgi to write a
lot of useless log lines. This can make it more difficult to find
a problem with a particular service.

This patch adds a route to look for the `osa-haproxy-healthcheck`
user agent string, which haproxy uses when performing health checks.
Any requests with that user agent are not logged.

Closes-Bug: 1742718
Change-Id: I92658731ce93e4d2dbcadb53e80a08f19fe928fe
'}]
commit_message:
Skip logging for haproxy health checks

The health check requests from haproxy cause uwsgi to write a
lot of useless log lines. This can make it more difficult to find
a problem with a particular service.

This patch adds a route to look for the `osa-haproxy-healthcheck`
user agent string, which haproxy uses when performing health checks.
Any requests with that user agent are not logged.

Closes-Bug: 1742718
Change-Id: I92658731ce93e4d2dbcadb53e80a08f19fe928fe

Update specs repo for Queens

Move the implemented Queens specs from 'approved' to 'implemented'
and set up redirects so links to 'approved' won't break.

commit_message:
Add dnsmasq and qos support for OpenWRT VNFM management driver

This also includes using a custom image that fixes the issue of
OpenWRT keeps respawning:

https://bugs.launchpad.net/tacker/+bug/1557008

And fixed by haint at https://review.openstack.org/#/c/543413/

Change-Id: I05430ead22bd6a89953b1f0df025a32b3cb43dcc
Implements: blueprint advanced-openwrt-driver

Looks fine but we need the master change to land first.

 $ get-all-requirements.py --pkgs pylxd --branch stable/queens
 Package      : pylxd [pylxd>=2.2.4] (used by 0 projects)

Also I assume this is pre-emptive so that when nova-lxd branches it has the latest version ready to go.'}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2018-02-21 07:28:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

ya, -1 til upper-reqs unfreeze (during ptg)'}, {'account_id': 20870, 'date': '2018-02-22 20:16:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Okay, thanks for the update.  Never quite sure what's the correct policy during this period."}, {'account_id': 20870, 'date': '2018-02-23 16:36:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

So we definitely can't push this through? I only ask because my stable/queens branch (just cut) for nova-lxd can't pass its gate due to needing pylxd 2.2.5."}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2018-02-23 16:38:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

What project is oyur stable/queens branch for?  Can you link to the gate?'}, {'account_id': 20870, 'date': '2018-02-23 16:40:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Sure, yep: it's nova-lxd: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/547423/1"}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2018-02-23 16:45:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

those failures don't look related"}, {'account_id': 20870, 'date': '2018-02-23 17:16:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

It's a change in how the images are handled in pylxd; the screen-n-cpu file shows the mismatch is between nova-lxd and pylxd ... this passes in master with pylxd 2.2.5"}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2018-02-23 17:19:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

ok, as this is needed to unbreak a project I'll +2 it"}, {'account_id': 20870, 'date': '2018-02-23 17:59:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Thanks Matthew; appreciate the exception.'}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-02-27 09:09:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]

commit_message:
capture cell name

see: https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/24152a8f8fb60ae0f306bbf21fe775a2c5bafbc8/nova/notifications/base.py#L434

i'm not adding meter because cell_name doesn't exist in libvirt
metadata so libvirt_metadata polling will never find it.

Change-Id: I58e35261e23041f640b73fecc1e4082db067abe9

subject: hyper-v: Converts all os-win exceptions
messages: [{'account_id': 8213, 'date': '2018-02-22 16:12:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6537, 'date': '2018-02-25 21:28:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 2813, 'date': '2018-02-27 09:23:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 8213, 'date': '2018-02-27 10:40:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked\n\nThis patchset was cherry picked to branch stable/queens as commit 6dc51953b590eb063fefd3834bdffa7c1e0c5170'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-22 16:12:12.000000000', 'message': 'hyper-v: Converts all os-win exceptions

When os-win was first introduced, a decorator which converts all os-win
exceptions to virt inspector exceptions has been added to the
HyperVInspector.

However, the decorator works as intended for methods that return values,
and not for the ones that yield (they return a generator).

This patch makes sure that exceptions are converted properly for yielding
methods as well.

Closes-Bug #1751088

Change-Id: I7d09e1860c6940758f0d0965fedfe4dd285e0cae
'}]
commit_message:
hyper-v: Converts all os-win exceptions

When os-win was first introduced, a decorator which converts all os-win
exceptions to virt inspector exceptions has been added to the
HyperVInspector.

However, the decorator works as intended for methods that return values,
and not for the ones that yield (they return a generator).

This patch makes sure that exceptions are converted properly for yielding
methods as well.

Closes-Bug #1751088

Change-Id: I7d09e1860c6940758f0d0965fedfe4dd285e0cae

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-26 11:25:55.000000000', 'message': 'Fixed telemetry integration zuul jobs

* telemetry integration tests run in tempest-venv so plugin
  needs to be installed in the same venv. devstack plugin installs
  the plugin all-plugin venv so tests are not discovered by tempest.
  In order to fix the same we need to use TEMPEST_PLUGINS vars for
  the same.
* telemetry integration tests are dependent on heat-tempest-plugin
  so we need to add that to the required projects.

Change-Id: Icab1e53d20bb7c95c232a4512e83905dcca7c599
(cherry picked from commit ff913ae76b1b3ef24c019fb4bf6689ba3340005f)
'}]
commit_message:
Fixed telemetry integration zuul jobs

* telemetry integration tests run in tempest-venv so plugin
  needs to be installed in the same venv. devstack plugin installs
  the plugin all-plugin venv so tests are not discovered by tempest.
  In order to fix the same we need to use TEMPEST_PLUGINS vars for
  the same.
* telemetry integration tests are dependent on heat-tempest-plugin
  so we need to add that to the required projects.

Change-Id: Icab1e53d20bb7c95c232a4512e83905dcca7c599
(cherry picked from commit ff913ae76b1b3ef24c019fb4bf6689ba3340005f)

commit_message:
Remove max-ready-age from nodepool

We've landed a fix in nodepool to help reduce the chance of a provider
wedge. Remove max-ready-age, to allow our nodepool fix to handle the
issue.

Change-Id: I02b7112d4fdfb0315ad964924692b0968bdf76b4
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/539316
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

messages:
[{'account_id': 17109, 'date': '2018-02-05 04:16:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 26515, 'date': '2018-02-05 05:25:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

For rechecking only on the Cloudbase Hyper-V CI, add a review comment with check hyper-v

- nova-dsvm-full-tempest http://cloudbase-ci.com//nova/540709/1/ : FAILURE in 1h 08m 25s'}, {'account_id': 7634, 'date': '2018-02-05 06:09:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

There was a patch to fix the message for master (*1).
But Ocata is in "Phase II – Maintained release" (*2).
In phase II, only critical bugfixes and security patches are acceptable (*3).
So it should not be backported to stable/ocata.

*1: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/420060/
*2: https://releases.openstack.org/
*3: https://docs.openstack.org/project-team-guide/stable-branches.html#support-phases'}, {'account_id': 7166, 'date': '2018-02-07 09:06:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I'm fine with backporting that change to Ocata since it's just a nit and fixing some misunderstanding. The only issue I have with that change is that I don't see a master change.

Please provide that fix against the master branch first, and proceed to backports to the Pike and Ocata branches only when the master change is merged.
See https://docs.openstack.org/project-team-guide/stable-branches.html#processes for details."}, {'account_id': 27336, 'date': '2018-02-07 09:38:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

There was a patch to fix the message for master (*1).
But Ocata is in "Phase II – Maintained release" (*2).
In phase II, only critical bugfixes and security patches are acceptable (*3).
So it should not be backported to stable/ocata.

*1: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/420060/
*2: https://releases.openstack.org/
*3: https://docs.openstack.org/project-team-guide/stable-branches.html#support-phases'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-02-27 10:12:59.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

@Takashi, docs and low-risk changes are fine in stable regardless of phase. The problem here is the change is not a backport, as Sylvain pointed out. Given there have been no updates, I'm going to abandon this."}]

commit_message:
Adds ability to modify vcpu count and add custom ansible params.

  This change allows someone to modify the vcpu count settings
  similar to how the ram is currently done.  It also allows for
  custom ansible parameters via an MNAIO_ANSIBLE_PARAMETERS var
  to add custom ansible parameters for the vpcu overrides as well
  as other settings.

Change-Id: I3c1fa7b55a87931eff586c0e983bb9b8c6f34fc3
Closes-Bug: 1750402

commit_message:
Isolate config parse_args for placement

The default parse_args needs to import RPC and database related modules
that are not required in the placement context. A new _parse_args
method is adding to wsgi.py which does the minimal required work.

Change-Id: I191a237d3276bf20edc6d5ab44e7eca0b802d0fb

commit_message:
Support running containers in specified AZ

Add a new parameter 'availaibility_zone' to the REST API for
creating containers. The API server will pass down this parameter
the the scheduler as extra_spec. In the filter scheduler, add
a 'AvailabilityZoneFilter' filter for selecting hosts in the
requested availability zone. Below is the host selection scenario:

* If users specify an AZ for the container, scheduler will choose
  a host in the user-specified AZ.
* If users don't specify an AZ for the container, the AZ will be
  default to CONF.default_schedule_zone if this config is set.
* If users don't specify an AZ for the container and
  CONF.default_schedule_zone is not set (None), the scheduler will
  choose a host in arbitrary AZ.

Partial-Implements: blueprint zun-availability-zone
Change-Id: I01b8069f76e87a8e0c782da0888eee8a8cd58193

subject: resource: don't early terminate list
messages:
[{'account_id': 21781, 'date': '2018-01-31 06:38:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 21781, 'date': '2018-01-31 08:46:40.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 27566, 'date': '2018-01-31 08:49:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 27552, 'date': '2018-01-31 10:50:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 8257, 'date': '2018-01-31 12:53:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Are we confident that this will work in all cases? This would not have worked a few years ago for all services and was why this handling had to be in there.

"APIs can set max_limit to the number of items returned in each query." — The fact that they *can* set max_limit doesn't tell me that they *must* set it, which would mean this will be a regression on servers that don't use this setting.'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2018-01-31 14:12:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

I was going to respond that this would break swift because of how we have to calculate pagination based on max objects there ... but I'm wrong and this is actually completely correct, thank you for the catch!

limit is "number of results to return in each iteration" - not "number of total results to return". Because we return python iterators for list operations, a user who wants to only consume X records can simply stop iterating after reaching X. They can control the batch-size of the remote interactions with the limit parameter.'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2018-01-31 14:14:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Cherry Picked

This patchset was cherry picked to branch stable/queens as commit 76b794214cd394c5d178b4822307a2943eadfb4b'}, {'account_id': 21781, 'date': '2018-02-01 10:20:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> Are we confident that this will work in all cases? This would not
 > have worked a few years ago for all services and was why this
 > handling had to be in there.
 > 
 > "APIs can set max_limit to the number of items returned in each
 > query." — The fact that they *can* set max_limit doesn't tell me
 > that they *must* set it, which would mean this will be a regression
 > on servers that don't use this setting.

The only regression here I can see is that an extra query would be sent to the API and API returns an empty list, which may not be optimal. However this can happen even without this commit when "total_number_of_items % limit == 0". For example, resource.list() is called with paginated=True and limit=1, then it won't be early terminated and the last query will be returned an empty list as well.

Do you mean that some services may not handle the aforementioned last query well? If so then this change do make the problem 100% happening. Or I'm missing something here?'}, {'account_id': 3099, 'date': '2018-02-01 14:45:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 22998, 'date': '2018-02-27 09:24:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Maybe this patch caused such command`openstack cluster action list --limit 3` bug.'}, {'account_id': 23517, 'date': '2018-02-27 09:54:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Yes, I've already confirmed it."}]

commit_message:
resource: don't early terminate list

APIs can set the max_limit to the number of items returned in each
query. If that max_limit is smaller than the limit given by the user,
the API will never return as many records as the limit, however that
doesn't mean there are no more records. So the list should not be
early terminated.

Closes-Bug: #1746410

Change-Id: I893f4b3ba0856476f81189d741de1aed8aa65e25

As far as this spec goes, it'll only make the difference between 'host' and 'node', but I need to understand the RT flow for ironic better."}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-02-19 19:14:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-02-19 19:16:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-02-19 20:23:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7: Code-Review+1

(1 comment)

OK this looks alright to me now with the diagram to make the relationships clear and what you get in the driver method wrt the trees and sharing providers.

To reiterate what I said in IRC about this, in general I'm not crazy about the idea of a virt driver managing shared provider trees, which at least one driver (PowerVM) has said it wants/needs to do for something like the shared storage pool, and knowing that multiple nova-compute instances could be sharing the same storage pool and managing it at the same time, concurrency issues and all. We have said that nova should do less orchestration overall, but this means the virt drivers will/can actually do more orchestration rather than some external system, which I think is unfortunate.

I won't attempt to block this because of that, since I think the ProviderTree concept is still useful on its own for the more exotic scheduling things people want to do with nova, and it nicely combines the various inventory/traits/aggregates attributes behind a single abstraction, which should make working with placement from nova-compute easier."}, {'account_id': 1063, 'date': '2018-02-19 22:04:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review+1

Thanks for the artwork!'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-02-20 13:11:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review+1

yup, nice clarification'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2018-02-20 15:38:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review+2

(2 comments)

yeah, I think this is ready. thanks Eric.

[{'created': '2018-02-01 19:47:37.000000000', 'message': 'Update Provider Tree

In the movement towards using placement for scheduling and resource
management, the virt driver method get_available_resource was initially
superseded by get_inventory, whereby the driver could specify its
inventory in terms understood by placement. In Queens, a get_traits
driver method was added. But get_inventory is limited to expressing only
inventory (not traits or aggregates). And both of these methods are
limited to the resource provider corresponding to the compute node.

Recent developments such as Nested Resource Providers necessitate the
ability for the virt driver to have deeper control over what the
resource tracker configures in placement on behalf of the compute node.

This specification proposes a new virt driver method,
update_provider_tree, and its method of consumption by the resource
tracker, allowing full control over the placement representation of the
compute node and its associated providers and metadata.

Change-Id: I5870bd68be3d16d64dc3ac82a1020b10d29ffae9

commit_message:
Update Provider Tree

In the movement towards using placement for scheduling and resource
management, the virt driver method get_available_resource was initially
superseded by get_inventory, whereby the driver could specify its
inventory in terms understood by placement. In Queens, a get_traits
driver method was added. But get_inventory is limited to expressing only
inventory (not traits or aggregates). And both of these methods are
limited to the resource provider corresponding to the compute node.

Recent developments such as Nested Resource Providers necessitate the
ability for the virt driver to have deeper control over what the
resource tracker configures in placement on behalf of the compute node.

This specification proposes a new virt driver method,
update_provider_tree, and its method of consumption by the resource
tracker, allowing full control over the placement representation of the
compute node and its associated providers and metadata.

Change-Id: I5870bd68be3d16d64dc3ac82a1020b10d29ffae9
blueprint: update-provider-tree

commit_message:
ceph plugin installation: umount correct device if it existed.

The loopback device is created for ceph osd. If the directory
${storage_data_dir} has been mounted when create disk, we should
umount ${storage_data_dir} instead of ${storage_data_dir}/drives/sdb1.

Change-Id: Ie9fe81c820c485dab9f049cf5a81c02424925728
Closes-Bug: #1689089

commit_message:
Fix PostgreSQL non-dynamic configration tests

The parameter 'log_min_duration_statement' was updated to support unit
suffixes like 'ms' in [1], but reverted in [2] by accident.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/370982/
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/537665/

Change-Id: I6fa6785bc8438ccc28a815abd1a99526ff03b87c
Signed-off-by: Zhao Chao <zhaochao1984@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Improve services management

Manage all services in the database, and set all
enabled by default.

we can enabled/disabled service via api:
  * enable service: PUT /v1/info/services/compute -d {"enable":1}
  * disable service: PUT /v1/info/services/compute -d {"enable":0}

This can be work without restart cloudkitty processor.

Change-Id: I8d0759e7581be526aaea7cdc23ee2a562c944929
Implements: blueprint enable-disable-service

commit_message:
Add connectivity check for preexisting_port test

Add connectivity check when booting the second guest
with the same port.

This check is need because we saw cases when SDN e.g
ODL not handling correctly the re-use of the same port.

Change-Id: Ib233f1a453df88a100d00dabe3190030f8675e8a

commit_message:
Use local cirros image if available

Nodepool nodes saves the cirros image in /opt/cache/files/, we can make
use of it to save some time and remove an external dependency on the
cirros website.

Change-Id: I81b431d8659b1da8b36d660f2a8f1cfa42461a14

commit_message:
Revert "Don't try to lock for vif detach"

This is causing more serious issues, as there is a race
between tenant VIF removal and cleaning VIF adding.

This reverts commit 4f79cb3932f2518ab3f06b86ceea065cbb399e8c.

The release note is not deleted from it, because the change has
already been released. A new one is added instead.

Closes-Bug: #1750785

commit_message:
umount the data directory in the right path

The stack.sh will create a mount point that as '/var/lib/ceph/',
however when run the script again, it will failed to umount an
wrong path.

Fix by umount the right one.

Change-Id: Ie8152cd44c37a43d7ff4b56cfd674e5a4e4e94ff
Closes-bug: #1751446

This command is not run in the CI, it only breaks local invocations,

add-id-and-uuid-filtering-to-sqalchemy-api.yaml

Change-Id: I240aed4c829b3c3533cdbd6dda75c8dfa017cea6
"}]
commit_message:
Stop running check-releasenotes in `tox -e releasenotes`

This command is not run in the CI, it only breaks local invocations,
and it's breaking right now due to one of recent notes:
add-id-and-uuid-filtering-to-sqalchemy-api.yaml

Change-Id: I240aed4c829b3c3533cdbd6dda75c8dfa017cea6

commit_message:
allow to config port binding:profile

When using OVS HW offload feature we need to create
neutron port with  --binding-profile '{"capabilities": ["switchdev"]}' [1]
To allow this feature to be tested with Mellanox CI we need a way
to configure the port binding:profile in tempest

[1] - https://review.openstack.org/#/c/504911/

Change-Id: I9b562aaabf960d38f623d88e8b88619edbb70fe8

commit_message:
Do not test create_interface_by_fixed_ips if no isolated network

By default only project that is admin or network owner or project
with role advsvc is authorised to create interfaces with fixed-ip,
so if we don't create network for each project, do not test
_test_create_interface_by_fixed_ips.

This is to split test_create_list_show_delete_interfaces to two testcases,
so we can get to know that whether we tested interface by fixed_ips or not.
And test_create_list_show_delete_interfaces is not used in interop so
we can safely change it.

/etc/neutron/policy.json:
"create_port:fixed_ips": "rule:context_is_advsvc or rule:admin_or_network_owner"

description for context_is_advsvc:
https://github.com/openstack/neutron/commit/d4f00659eb18c6a5df2ce6d35202b0a4a9409f70

Change-Id: Ia4b6083eb7e5d8a69aff949d301ad5a118180bd9

commit_message:
Claim resources when updating cpu/memory

Currently, we update the container's cpu/memory without a resource
claim. This leads to issue that a container can be updated to
get more resources than available. This patch adds a step to
claim cpu/memory when updating the container.

Co-Authored-By: Hongbin Lu <hongbin034@gmail.com>

Partial-Implements: blueprint resize-via-scheduler
Change-Id: I35646123757cf9b7e0be7dcb4ea6b3d18cd00ecc

Add a new attribute 'availability_zone' to the 'service' resource.
This attribute indicates the availability zone of the zun-compute
agent. Cloud administrators can customize the availability zone of
each compute node by setting the following in the config file:

  [DEFAULT]
  default_availability_zone = my-zone

If this is not set, the default availability zone is 'nova'
(we use this value for consistency with neutron and cinder's defaults).

In the future, we will add support for scheduling containers to
a specified AZ and the 'availability_zone' attribute will be used
by scheduler to check if the availability zone of the compute node
equals to the one requested by API users.

commit_message:
Add availability_zone to service

Add a new attribute 'availability_zone' to the 'service' resource.
This attribute indicates the availability zone of the zun-compute
agent. Cloud administrators can customize the availability zone of
each compute node by setting the following in the config file:

  [DEFAULT]
  default_availability_zone = my-zone

If this is not set, the default availability zone is 'nova'
(we use this value for consistency with neutron and cinder's defaults).

In the future, we will add support for scheduling containers to
a specified AZ and the 'availability_zone' attribute will be used
by scheduler to check if the availability zone of the compute node
equals to the one requested by API users.

Change-Id: I4a4206b4eb0aa5149bbfc8ab72ae408a08317de4
Partial-Implements: blueprint zun-availability-zone

commit_message:
Delete redundant code

   In function update_task, the following codes have already judged
action is in (self.UPDATE, self.ROLLBACK, self.RESTORE), therefore
the deleted code is not necessary.

if action not in (self.UPDATE, self.ROLLBACK, self.RESTORE):
            LOG.error("Unexpected action %s passed to update!", action)
            self.state_set(self.UPDATE, self.FAILED,
                           "Invalid action %s" % action)
            return

Change-Id: I85f4aaf4c294923358172896cf8efcb5af238957

commit_message:
Use oslo_db.sqlalchemy.test_fixtures

The change in Idfab443dba26e94d9e50814cf7ffc5624748b476
makes use of oslo_db.tests.*, which was not the intent of the
deprecations added to oslo_db in
I0163e637ffef6d45d2573ebe29b5438911d01fce.   Make use of the
newer fixtures in oslo_db.sqlalchemy.test_fixtures which is
what was intended to supersede oslo_db.sqlalchemy.test_base.

Change-Id: Iff0c77f60c4e8b48c56d165653b1d27295d0aa2e
(cherry picked from commit 6682a3d1c73ebdacdad54256e2e9bf65fbdf7a87)

subject: Increase the instance_info column size to LONGTEXT on MySQL/MariaDB

Absolutely need a release note detailing the change for users upgrading so they can anticipate if their upgrade will be five seconds or five minutes.  I would wonder how long that would take with 10k+ nodes, but realistically the existing data structures are not that big.   My only fear is this is something that can never really be un-done, and could result in some very large database entries.  Personally, I'd rather see the configdrive completely broken out of instance_info. :("}, {'account_id': 20498, 'date': '2016-07-22 14:23:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Just curious. Well this have any issue for rolling/live upgrades?

Maybe two conductors active, one pre-upgrade and one post-upgrade.'}, {'account_id': 14760, 'date': '2016-09-07 00:00:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

> Just curious. Well this have any issue for rolling/live upgrades?
 > 
 > Maybe two conductors active, one pre-upgrade and one post-upgrade.

s/Well this/Will this/'}, {'account_id': 15427, 'date': '2016-09-07 06:41:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

> > Just curious. Well this have any issue for rolling/live upgrades?
 > >
 > > Maybe two conductors active, one pre-upgrade and one
 > post-upgrade.
 > 
 > s/Well this/Will this/

So first let me define the potentially problematic situation to ensure that we're aligned:
1. Pre upgrade: 2 conductors in which instance_info is defined as the good old JsonEncodedType and in mysql the column is defined as TEXT
2. Upgrade starts, in mysql the column is defined as LONGTEXT, 1 conductor is upgraded and now instance_info is defined as JsonEncodedType(mysql_as_long=True) and the non-upgraded conductor is still with the good old JsonEncodedType

Right after the upgrade there shouldn't be no issue since all of the existing instance_info data was written as TEXT so there's no problem for both conductors to read it.

The potential problem (if i understand correctly) is what happens if the upgraded conductor writes instance_info that is longer than TEXT and the non upgraded conductor tries to read it. Please correct me if my description or understanding is wrong.

So given that the above is the case you're referring - there's no issue there. I'll explain:
A. I've tried it :) In our downstream, the first thing that I did to fix the issue was to execute ALTER TABLE directly on the DB without any python code change and everything works
B. There's no reason in the code why the above shouldn't work. The JsonEncodedType doesn't have any internal constraint. Consider the fact that TEXT size is different between DB flavors and yet the same JsonEncodedType handles ALL DB flavors (in Postgres the bug that is solved here doesn't exist since TEXT is defined as unlimited - https://www.postgresql.org/docs/9.1/static/datatype-character.html)

Bottom line, no issue there :)"}, {'account_id': 14760, 'date': '2016-09-07 13:38:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review+2

Thanks David'}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2016-09-07 14:08:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8: Code-Review+1

(2 comments)

Functionally I'm good with the change.  I wouldn't mind seeing the release note revised though."}, {'account_id': 10343, 'date': '2016-09-08 14:40:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

I'm fairly certain mysql will read-lock the table during this ALTER TABLE statement, at least in versions 5.5 and lower. So online upgrades in a large-ish busy environment might not work well.

Now, we don't really test rolling upgrades, nor officially support them, so I think this is probably fine.

The way around this would be to add a new column, have new code use that column (and lazy-migrate the data as we use it), have a script to run before the release that drops the old column, and then drop it in a future release.

Not voting (yet) as I haven't really reviewed anything except the migration."}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2016-09-08 14:45:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8: Code-Review-1

Jroll suggested that perhaps we break this out to a separate table, and the idea is growing on me more and more as once this field is in place, that means changes to this table could result in extremely long locks on the table, which is something we need to avoid for online upgrades.  The data may be small now, and wouldn't be bad for an operator to upgrade, but if someone has 64MB per node, that could be a very time consuming upgrade."}, {'account_id': 10342, 'date': '2016-09-08 15:32:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review-1

I have major concerns about ballooning the instance_info field to 4GB.'}, {'account_id': 20498, 'date': '2016-09-08 16:05:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review-1

I would think that MEDIUMTEXT (if available) is a more sane value. That has a maximum size of 16 MiB. Which still seems big. But LONGTEXT and 4GiB does seem like overkill.

I do think 64KiB is too small for some of our users.

We might want to come up with some value we think is reasonable as a maximum and have the code enforce this maximum size, even if the maximum size is less than the database.'}, {'account_id': 20498, 'date': '2016-09-08 16:31:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

For the storage requirements see here [1] and here [2].

[1] http://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/5.7/en/storage-requirements.html
[2] http://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/5.7/en/innodb-file-space.html'}, {'account_id': 14760, 'date': '2016-09-08 20:53:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

https://github.com/openstack/ironic/blob/f1b58b7dae813244519b14f51c4dadc29f16e178/ironic/conductor/manager.py#L2329-L2363

There could be a check on maximum size for configdrives that will not be stored in Swift. Not sure what that maximum size should be.'}, {'account_id': 15427, 'date': '2016-09-08 21:41:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

> I would think that MEDIUMTEXT (if available) is a more sane value.
 > That has a maximum size of 16 MiB. Which still seems big. But
 > LONGTEXT and 4GiB does seem like overkill.
 > 
 > I do think 64KiB is too small for some of our users.
 > 
 > We might want to come up with some value we think is reasonable as
 > a maximum and have the code enforce this maximum size, even if the
 > maximum size is less than the database.

+1 for MEDIUMTEXT. It's a TBD described in the bug (MEDIUMTEXT vs LONGTEXT) which was not defined properly yet.
Nova's user-data column type is MEDIUMTEXT for mysql so it seems appropriate.

MariaDB [nova]> describe instances;
+--------------------------+-----------------------+------+-----+---------+----------------+
| Field                    | Type                  | Null | Key | Default | Extra          |
+--------------------------+-----------------------+------+-----+---------+----------------+
| created_at               | datetime              | YES  |     | NULL    |                |
| updated_at               | datetime              | YES  |     | NULL    |                |
...
| user_data                | mediumtext            | YES  |     | NULL    |                |
..."}, {'account_id': 15427, 'date': '2016-09-08 22:09:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 15427, 'date': '2016-09-08 22:09:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

 > 
 > I think the default should be 64KiB, so it is approximately the
 > same as it is now. And then operators if they decide to can
 > increase the value.

Though I like the idea of something that is controlled by the operator, I don't see how can/if the code handles changes in the value. Let's say that the default if 64KiB and the operator wants to change it to 16MiB - should the upgrade code be executed as a result of this change? when?

Or maybe I'm missing something here?"}, {'account_id': 14760, 'date': '2016-09-12 21:20:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9:

 > result of this change? when?

 > Or maybe I'm missing something here?

No. My thought is that it would be migrated but the config option would restrict it to 64KiB. So after this patch it would appear as nothing had changed. But then an operator could increase the size if they desired. So that way their database couldn't massively increase its size (for this field) without them knowing about it."}, {'account_id': 14760, 'date': '2016-09-12 21:30:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: -Code-Review'}, {'account_id': 15427, 'date': '2016-09-12 21:30:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9:

> > > I mostly like this. But I think it would be good to add a
 > config
 > > > option for a maximum size for the configdrive (if being stored
 > in
 > > > the database).
 > > >
 > > > I think the change would be here:
 > > > https://github.com/openstack/ironic/blob/42bf32be9ea7bc7a8f0bfdc08d91c71f52af49de/ironic/conductor/manager.py#L2329-L2363
 > > >
 > > > I think the default should be 64KiB, so it is approximately the
 > > > same as it is now. And then operators if they decide to can
 > > > increase the value.
 > >
 > > Though I like the idea of something that is controlled by the
 > > operator, I don't see how can/if the code handles changes in the
 > > value. Let's say that the default if 64KiB and the operator wants
 > > to change it to 16MiB - should the upgrade code be executed as a
 > > result of this change? when?
 > >
 > > Or maybe I'm missing something here?
 > 
 > No. My thought is that it would be migrated but the config option
 > would restrict it to 64KiB. So after this patch it would appear as
 > nothing had changed. But then an operator could increase the size
 > if they desired. So that way their database couldn't massively
 > increase its size (for this field) without them knowing about it.

ok.
So it's a code constraint - the DB will be upgraded anyway to 16MiB but the code will validate that value inserted/updated is not bigger than the configuration.
I understand correctly?"}, {'account_id': 14760, 'date': '2016-09-12 22:24:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9:

> So it's a code constraint - the DB will be upgraded anyway to 16MiB
 > but the code will validate that value inserted/updated is not

 > I understand correctly?

Yep. That is my idea."}, {'account_id': 14760, 'date': '2016-09-12 22:26:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9:

Also, I can't help but think that this change requires an RFE (Request For Enhancement). We don't seem to have agreement on if this is a good or a bad thing. So filing an RFE on this would probably be a good idea.

We have a policy wrt changes to the DB model [1] which explicitly mentions no alter_column(). And Julia is concerned about long locks on the table (comment in patch set 8), although she now thinks "I was more thinking from upgrade strategy standpoint, although it is a column locking schema change, it shouldn't lock the table for long nor rewrite the table".

Apart from the above two concerns, I'm good with this. I'm not an expert DB person, and am not comfortable landing this without testing/verifying for myself that it works (which I'm not going to do cuz... time...) so someone else is welcome to DO IT. (Much as I'd love to land this, are we really sure we want to do it at this point, vs just getting rid/not storing configdrive in DB?)

commit_message:
Increase the instance_info column size to LONGTEXT on MySQL/MariaDB

In MySQL, the maximum size of TEXT is 64KiB. The instance_info column
is defined as TEXT and can potentially hold big amount of data
(partly affected by cloud-init scripts for the node).

This patch-set resizes nodes.instance_info to LONGTEXT which allows up
to 4GiB of data to be stored in the column. This change is relevant only
to MySQL and does not affect PostgreSQL or any other DB flavor. The fix
also addresses the upgrade process of the column.

Change-Id: Ifb9a49d4258a559cf2175d902e9424a3f98065c5
Closes-Bug: #1596421

Correct me if I'm wrong, but this as-is would introduce a new hard-dependency on having a volume service (e.g. Cinder) deployed. Please make it optional. Gate jobs exclude installing Cinder, so something you might also need to touch.

In addition, if we move forward, I would like to see:

- tempest tests
- release notes"}, {'account_id': 21486, 'date': '2018-02-24 02:25:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1'}, {'account_id': 6579, 'date': '2018-02-25 17:43:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

 > Please make it optional. Gate jobs exclude installing Cinder, so
 > something you might also need to touch.
 > 
 > In addition, if we move forward, I would like to see:
 > 
 > - unit tests
 > - tempest tests
 > - release notes

+1

Such a change to how a main flow works usually requires a discussion (in a form of IRC meeting, Spec and preferably both).
Additionally, there's another patch that adds volume based amphorae here: I1ebe781671c05ee23b7170901d3be66b8b580fd1
That one adds this as an optional feature."}, {'account_id': 10273, 'date': '2018-02-26 09:44:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

[{'created': '2018-02-22 08:11:34.000000000', 'message': 'Do not use "-y" for package install

According to "code conventions" [1], do not use "-y" option.
Instead, use apt-get install package, yum install package,
or zypper install package.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/doc-contrib-guide/writing-style/code-conventions.html

Change-Id: I75936edb4ee2536abd9343585fcccb5b1a9c7db2
'}]
commit_message:
Do not use "-y" for package install

According to "code conventions" [1], do not use "-y" option.
Instead, use apt-get install package, yum install package,
or zypper install package.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/doc-contrib-guide/writing-style/code-conventions.html

Change-Id: I75936edb4ee2536abd9343585fcccb5b1a9c7db2

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-23 21:53:28.000000000', 'message': 'Create NOVA_READY_TIMEOUT in is_nova_ready function

The function was introduced in [0] using a hardcoded timeout of 60
seconds which turns out to be too small on slow machines. Create a new
global variable NOVA_READY_TIMEOUT instead so that users can
override the timeout if necessary.

[0] I32eb59b9d6c225a3e93992be3a3b9f4b251d7189

Co-Authored-By: Mohammed Naser <mnaser@vexxhost.com>
Change-Id: I0cd7f193589a1a0776ae76dc30cecefe7ba9e5db
'}]
commit_message:
Create NOVA_READY_TIMEOUT in is_nova_ready function

The function was introduced in [0] using a hardcoded timeout of 60
seconds which turns out to be too small on slow machines. Create a new
global variable NOVA_READY_TIMEOUT instead so that users can
override the timeout if necessary.

[0] I32eb59b9d6c225a3e93992be3a3b9f4b251d7189

Co-Authored-By: Mohammed Naser <mnaser@vexxhost.com>
Change-Id: I0cd7f193589a1a0776ae76dc30cecefe7ba9e5db

[{'created': '2018-01-05 15:49:35.000000000', 'message': 'Fix error message in the manage API

When the manage API is called on a particular share without specifying
the share type and the also the default share type is not found, the API
raises an error message which contains the share_type_id of default
sharetype which is not existant. The error message which should be
displayed is "Default share type not found.". The fix for this bug is
to change the parameters sent to the ShareTypeNotFound class, changing
it from ShareTypeNotFound(reason=msg) to ShareTypeNotFound(message=msg).

**Previously:
manila manage \
stack-VirtualBox@prague#lvm-single-pool \
NFS \
127.0.0.1:/opt/stack/data/manila/mnt/share-2cd5d0de-994b-4cbf-bf55-9808e
49266f0
ERROR: Share type %(share_type_id)s could not be found.

**Now:
manila manage \
stack-VirtualBox@prague#lvm-single-pool \
NFS \
127.0.0.1:/opt/stack/data/manila/mnt/share-2cd5d0de-994b-4cbf-bf55-9808e
49266f0
ERROR: Default share type not found.

Closes-Bug: #1705533
Change-Id: I36a76a93b7d0f54c1e9aec43e332cb94b0b389f3
(cherry picked from commit c4b59336c28b5040931d535dd7dcaa5653239b65)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix error message in the manage API

When the manage API is called on a particular share without specifying
the share type and the also the default share type is not found, the API
raises an error message which contains the share_type_id of default
sharetype which is not existant. The error message which should be
displayed is "Default share type not found.". The fix for this bug is
to change the parameters sent to the ShareTypeNotFound class, changing
it from ShareTypeNotFound(reason=msg) to ShareTypeNotFound(message=msg).

**Previously:
manila manage \
stack-VirtualBox@prague#lvm-single-pool \
NFS \
127.0.0.1:/opt/stack/data/manila/mnt/share-2cd5d0de-994b-4cbf-bf55-9808e
49266f0
ERROR: Share type %(share_type_id)s could not be found.

**Now:
manila manage \
stack-VirtualBox@prague#lvm-single-pool \
NFS \
127.0.0.1:/opt/stack/data/manila/mnt/share-2cd5d0de-994b-4cbf-bf55-9808e
49266f0
ERROR: Default share type not found.

Closes-Bug: #1705533
Change-Id: I36a76a93b7d0f54c1e9aec43e332cb94b0b389f3
(cherry picked from commit c4b59336c28b5040931d535dd7dcaa5653239b65)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-13 05:34:17.000000000', 'message': 'Fix expirer's invalid task object names in unit tests

Object-expirer's task name should be in format of
"<timestamp>-<account>/<container>/<obj>". In object-expirer
implementation, ValueError is catched and handled when expirer's task
objects have invalid name. But in actual swift cluster, invalid task
object name is not created because task object is created by
object-server.
However, without the ValueError catching, some unit tests fail,
because the unit tests create invalid task object names.

This patch removes the ValueError catching and fix invalid task
object names in unit tests.

This patch will help to refactor expirer's task object parsing.
I will push patch for the refactoring after this patch.

Change-Id: I8fab8fd180481ce9e97c945904c5c89eec037110

commit_message:
Fix expirer's invalid task object names in unit tests

Object-expirer's task name should be in format of
"<timestamp>-<account>/<container>/<obj>". In object-expirer
implementation, ValueError is catched and handled when expirer's task
objects have invalid name. But in actual swift cluster, invalid task
object name is not created because task object is created by
object-server.
However, without the ValueError catching, some unit tests fail,
because the unit tests create invalid task object names.

This patch fixes invalid task object names in unit tests. The
ValueError catch is remained for unexpected errors, but in the case
the task will be skipped.

This patch will help to refactor expirer's task object parsing.

Change-Id: I8fab8fd180481ce9e97c945904c5c89eec037110

commit_message:
Allows Configuration of Additional of Lbaas and Neutron

Using this, users can assign already available parameters
such as ovs_use_veth in lbaas_agent.ini and
ovs_integration_bridge in neutron.conf

Depends-On: I023e0476e574d5a4c13d66da390aa13016566058
Change-Id: I899fe9217cccbbf80113c74a77cc70961fe40f42

commit_message:
Add 3des to list of insecure ciphers

3DES has been removed from the default cipher string of ssl context [1]
and is also considered very slow [2]. Therefore we should start flagging
use of the cipher.

[1]: https://docs.python.org/2/library/ssl.html#ssl.create_default_context
[2]: https://cryptography.io/en/latest/hazmat/primitives/symmetric-encryption/#cryptography.hazmat.primitives.ciphers.algorithms.TripleDES

Change-Id: I530394b4748e8642e37375a59e76d76e4943e0c6

commit_message:
Add neutron-tempest-plugin-api job

The old tempest tests have been removed from the neutron repo, so
legacy-neutron-dsvm-api doesn't run anything at all anymore. Use the new
api job from the neutron-tempest-plugin repo instead.

Change-Id: I2d1854109474cee1923b9bffd75c3224a6f2b4bf

commit_message:

The ability to list instance actions for deleted servers was
added in the 2.21 microversion, so we should update the wording
to make that clear.

commit_message:
Pass nodes file to baremetal deploy script.

Previously all node configurations were kept in
internal files for baremetal deployments.
This change moves baremetal deployments to use
the standard nodes files.

Change-Id: Id8d0024ac1ed5a0815b0a6ebb048d1c162d71eec

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-23 20:33:50.000000000', 'message': "Get accurate listings while sharding shards

Listings of sharded or sharding root containers are constructed by
concatenating listing components from ACTIVE shards.

Before, the shard container GETs would alwaysfetch objects from the
target shard container regardless of its state.  Now, the listing
process is recursive i.e. if the target shard is itself sharding or
sharded then the listing component for that shard will be constructed
from its ACTIVE shards.

The header X-Backend-Record-Type = 'object' is used to override the
recursive listing mechanism when it is necessaray to GET a listing
component from a sharding container i.e. for the part of the namespace
that has not yet been cleaved. For container GETs,
X-Backend-Record-Type = 'object' therefore has the semantic 'return
objects from only the request path db'.

Change-Id: I2c25e41c5e858bb30fb9e124bd4cf2d03822e328
"}]
commit_message:
Get accurate listings while sharding shards

Listings of sharded or sharding root containers are constructed by
concatenating listing components from ACTIVE shards.

Before, the shard container GETs would alwaysfetch objects from the
target shard container regardless of its state.  Now, the listing
process is recursive i.e. if the target shard is itself sharding or
sharded then the listing component for that shard will be constructed
from its ACTIVE shards.

The header X-Backend-Record-Type = 'object' is used to override the
recursive listing mechanism when it is necessaray to GET a listing
component from a sharding container i.e. for the part of the namespace
that has not yet been cleaved. For container GETs,
X-Backend-Record-Type = 'object' therefore has the semantic 'return
objects from only the request path db'.

Change-Id: I2c25e41c5e858bb30fb9e124bd4cf2d03822e328

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-17 00:28:00.000000000', 'message': 'Clarify update_provider_tree docstring

Discussion in the update_provider_tree spec [1] concluded that we should
explicitly warn subclassers of the possibile existence of providers
(including descendants of the compute node RP) which are not
owned/managed by the compute driver.  This rewords the docstring per the
spec.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/540111/3/specs/rocky/approved/update-provider-tree.rst@146

Change-Id: I23cb41f1a40dd36e7a1b7ffd0fca325d25c75130
blueprint: update-provider-tree
'}]
commit_message:
Clarify update_provider_tree docstring

Discussion in the update_provider_tree spec [1] concluded that we should
explicitly warn subclassers of the possibile existence of providers
(including descendants of the compute node RP) which are not
owned/managed by the compute driver.  This rewords the docstring per the
spec.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/540111/3/specs/rocky/approved/update-provider-tree.rst@146

Change-Id: I23cb41f1a40dd36e7a1b7ffd0fca325d25c75130
blueprint: update-provider-tree

I think something needs to be fixed in these tests -- it seems ONLY related tests are failing, which indicates to me that a recheck/rebase isn't the solution. :("}, {'account_id': 5196, 'date': '2018-02-26 10:17:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7: Code-Review-1

This is actually specifically a unit test setup failure. The issue is tempest run is creating it's own .stestr.conf when --config-file is specified (note this is different from the config file specified on the cli, that's a tempest.conf and used when running tempest) So this unit test failure is ignoring the test setup in the unit test, which creates it's own .stestr.conf, and is trying to run tempest for real. Which is what the command is supposed to do with --config-file, but makes the unit test fail because we don't want to run tempest for real in a unit test."}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2018-02-26 10:32:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7: -Code-Review

(1 comment)

Thanks, it found new issues.

agree with matt and we should make tempest's creating and passing stestr.conf more explicit but at least till let's make it same as it used to be before stestr migration."}, {'account_id': 5689, 'date': '2018-02-26 10:35:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2018-02-26 12:21:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 5803, 'date': '2018-02-26 18:35:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]

commit_message:
Add unit test for tempest run --config-file

This commit adds a unit test for `tempest run --config-file`. That
if block was not tested in the gate. And an issue occurs like
this[0]. And this commit fixes a couple of issue in run.py through
adding this test.

[0] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/546822/

Change-Id: I235b822d802cf27d2dc43b35f85802d3a214b1b5

and older because the UCA shipped libvirt (2.5.0) is very slow

Change-Id: Ia5fd8654e062533a55de2e78d84128027c73c094
'}]
commit_message:
Bump NOVA_READY_TIMEOUT to 120s

This changes bumps NOVA_READY_TIMEOUT to 120s by default in Pike
and older because the UCA shipped libvirt (2.5.0) is very slow
to start up (taking almost a minute at times)

Change-Id: Ia5fd8654e062533a55de2e78d84128027c73c094

commit_message:
Node-Labels: Add linuxbridge node label to nodes

This PS adds the linxubridge node label to nodes to simplify
deployment and testing of the neutron linuxbridge backend.

Change-Id: I3095c21a75ad3057539f4fed431cb18c68e49a9b

commit_message:
add undercloud-setup to default tags

Setting up the undercloud is supported in various ways.
One can use an overcloud image, ovb ( baseos ) and
libvirt ( baseos ).

If the default tags are used the undercloud will
not be setup correctly

Closes-Bug: #1749786
Change-Id: Ife22410b77c954de95845ce9dc9067a32ab1db1c

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-26 14:10:19.000000000', 'message': 'Move eventlet patch before call to loadapp

Ran into an eventlet bug[0] while integration Swift/Barbican
in TripleO. It is very similar to a previous bug related
to keystonemiddleware[1]. Suggestion from urllib3[2] is to
patch eventlet "as early as possible". Traceback[3] shows that
urllib3 is being imported before the eventlet patch, so moved
the patch to before the loadapp call.

[0] - http://paste.openstack.org/show/658046/
[1] - https://bugs.launchpad.net/swift/+bug/1662473
[2] - https://github.com/shazow/urllib3/issues/1104
[3] - https://gist.github.com/thiagodasilva/12dad7dc4f940b046dd0863b6f82a78b

Change-Id: I74e580f31349bdefd187cc5d6770a7041a936bef
(cherry picked from commit c9410c7dd482cc1faefdfd9d9c83d225e7d28e8f)
'}]
commit_message:
Move eventlet patch before call to loadapp

Ran into an eventlet bug[0] while integration Swift/Barbican
in TripleO. It is very similar to a previous bug related
to keystonemiddleware[1]. Suggestion from urllib3[2] is to
patch eventlet "as early as possible". Traceback[3] shows that
urllib3 is being imported before the eventlet patch, so moved
the patch to before the loadapp call.

[0] - http://paste.openstack.org/show/658046/
[1] - https://bugs.launchpad.net/swift/+bug/1662473
[2] - https://github.com/shazow/urllib3/issues/1104
[3] - https://gist.github.com/thiagodasilva/12dad7dc4f940b046dd0863b6f82a78b

Change-Id: I74e580f31349bdefd187cc5d6770a7041a936bef
(cherry picked from commit c9410c7dd482cc1faefdfd9d9c83d225e7d28e8f)

commit_message:
Set openshift_(ip|hostname) to ctrlplane ip

When enabling network isolation, openshift-ansible picks the wrong ip
address as the default IP for the services. Set the IP to the ctrlplane
network by default, which works with and without network isolation.

Change-Id: I0deef6c2a71c1f2a34e6efed9586bbaa052b49c9

[{'created': '2018-02-26 15:17:00.000000000', 'message': 'Fix the install guide buttons on small screens

This patch fixes the nesting on the rows on the install guide
index page, that were causing all of the links to be covered on
smaller screens.

Unfortunately the high line count change is really required to
make the change easy to understand, as otherwise the indentation makes
it very difficult to notice the incorrect nesting (and probably caused
the bug in the first place).

Closes-Bug: 1751810
Change-Id: Id4e7ddf9d46d6e1a7f81a88047bb6778453cc9b8
'}]
commit_message:
Fix the install guide buttons on small screens

This patch fixes the nesting on the rows on the install guide
index page, that were causing all of the links to be covered on
smaller screens.

Unfortunately the high line count change is really required to
make the change easy to understand, as otherwise the indentation makes
it very difficult to notice the incorrect nesting (and probably caused
the bug in the first place).

Closes-Bug: 1751810
Change-Id: Id4e7ddf9d46d6e1a7f81a88047bb6778453cc9b8

[{'created': '2018-02-22 11:49:19.000000000', 'message': "Set 'initrd' to 'rescue_ramdisk' for rescue with iPXE

The kernel paramter 'initrd' is hard-coded as 'deploy_ramdisk' in iPXE
config template. A rescue ramdisk may fail to boot due to this wrong
paramter. This patch sets this 'initrd' paramter properly to
'deploy_ramdisk' or 'rescue_ramdisk' by adding a new pxe option.

Change-Id: I8ad1223dc289bbe915ee4ca8db66c8f80bf08f15
Closes-Bug: 1749860
(cherry picked from commit 8f2e487b2bd9168822268fcca1ab43ff93084afe)
"}]
commit_message:
Set 'initrd' to 'rescue_ramdisk' for rescue with iPXE

The kernel paramter 'initrd' is hard-coded as 'deploy_ramdisk' in iPXE
config template. A rescue ramdisk may fail to boot due to this wrong
paramter. This patch sets this 'initrd' paramter properly to
'deploy_ramdisk' or 'rescue_ramdisk' by adding a new pxe option.

Change-Id: I8ad1223dc289bbe915ee4ca8db66c8f80bf08f15
Closes-Bug: 1749860
(cherry picked from commit 8f2e487b2bd9168822268fcca1ab43ff93084afe)

[{'created': '2018-02-21 02:24:17.000000000', 'message': "Remove registry options from scrubber config

A recent change in glance removed the glance-scrubber utility's
dependency on the glance registry client. The scrubber now connects
directly to the database and these options are no longer needed.

(cherry picked from commit 45cb804dc252f3a9aaea1904c86958b99863086f)
"}, {'created': '2018-02-21 09:40:01.000000000', 'message': "Remove registry options from scrubber config

A recent change in glance removed the glance-scrubber utility's
dependency on the glance registry client. The scrubber now connects
directly to the database and these options are no longer needed.

Change-Id: I7389b7e090882eed93a56a6d8bdb297a7a3f9442
Related-Change: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/510449/
(cherry picked from commit 45cb804dc252f3a9aaea1904c86958b99863086f)

commit_message:
Remove registry options from scrubber config

A recent change in glance removed the glance-scrubber utility's
dependency on the glance registry client. The scrubber now connects
directly to the database and these options are no longer needed.

Change-Id: I7389b7e090882eed93a56a6d8bdb297a7a3f9442
Related-Change: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/510449/
(cherry picked from commit 45cb804dc252f3a9aaea1904c86958b99863086f)

[{'created': '2018-02-22 00:44:58.000000000', 'message': "Support nested objects and object lists in as_dict

The value returned by ironic.objects.IronicObject.as_dict() should be a
plain object, in order for it to be serialised to JSON. Currently,
nested object fields and object list fields are not converted to dict
format. This caused problems during cleaning, when the node object's
as_dict representation is JSON encoded and sent to IPA.

This change adds support for calling as_dict() on nested objects and
list objects, to ensure these are also returned in dict form.

We also change the method used in as_dict() for checking whether an
object has an attribute. The hasattr() function used previously has
problems when used with properties in python 2 [1], in that any
exceptions raised in the property getter result in hasattr() returning
False. Instead we use obj_attr_is_set() to determine whether the object
has a particular attribute.

[1] https://hynek.me/articles/hasattr/

Change-Id: Ib2166040508827db28d6f6e2d9a3e655c16f2993
Closes-Bug: #1750027

commit_message:
Support nested objects and object lists in as_dict

The value returned by ironic.objects.IronicObject.as_dict() should be a
plain object, in order for it to be serialised to JSON. Currently,
nested object fields and object list fields are not converted to dict
format. This caused problems during cleaning, when the node object's
as_dict representation is JSON encoded and sent to IPA.

This change adds support for calling as_dict() on nested objects and
list objects, to ensure these are also returned in dict form.

We also change the method used in as_dict() for checking whether an
object has an attribute. The hasattr() function used previously has
problems when used with properties in python 2 [1], in that any
exceptions raised in the property getter result in hasattr() returning
False. Instead we use obj_attr_is_set() to determine whether the object
has a particular attribute.

[1] https://hynek.me/articles/hasattr/

Change-Id: Ib2166040508827db28d6f6e2d9a3e655c16f2993
Closes-Bug: #1750027
(cherry picked from commit c66679f14b0b5f34462a896c3bff5a9f483a9a83)

[{'created': '2018-02-26 17:38:00.000000000', 'message': "Incorrect field choices in angular create user form

In angular user action workflow, we define a set of fields for the
user action form. When populating data for a form field, the field
data does not display properly due to the wrong field being taken
from the field set. These fields include 'domain_name', 'domain_id',
'project' and role.

Change-Id: Iba9d0a5522fcb4b388ed2f253d21ff05c05f185e
Closes-Bug:#1751385
"}]
commit_message:
Incorrect field choices in angular create user form

In angular user action workflow, we define a set of fields for the
user action form. When populating data for a form field, the field
data does not display properly due to the wrong field being taken
from the field set. These fields include 'domain_name', 'domain_id',
'project' and role.

Change-Id: Iba9d0a5522fcb4b388ed2f253d21ff05c05f185e
Closes-Bug:#1751385

* Nova can never be upgraded as there is a static pin that increments

as the python environments are shared between the old and new
installations.

In order to better isolate the running processes, as would be in
most actual production environments, we need to minimize underlying
inter-reactions due to python library upgrades.

massive conundrum was fully explained. Thanks Jim!

commit_message:
Disable .pyc files for grenade multinode

Ironic's grenade multinode suffers from some of unique issues.

* Nova can never be upgraded as there is a static pin that increments
  higher. As such, newer nova can never run with older ironic.
* As Nova cannot be upgraded, it is left running throughout the test
  sequence.

The above two conditions result in possible breaking package upgrades
as the python environments are shared between the old and new
installations.

In order to better isolate the running processes, as would be in
most actual production environments, we need to minimize underlying
inter-reactions due to python library upgrades.

Credit goes to Jim Rollenhagen for coming up with this idea, once the
massive conundrum was fully explained. Thanks Jim!

Partial-Bug: #1744139
Change-Id: Ifdd119d9cdde2ead6c3e36862cc77da67d10f7d1
(cherry picked from commit 93f376f3450b611842816f7248943350e4fd1a73)

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-14 12:22:31.000000000', 'message': 'libvirt: Don't VIR_MIGRATE_NON_SHARED_INC without migrate_disks

If we specify block migration, but there are no disks which actually
require block migration we call libvirt's migrateToURI3() with
VIR_MIGRATE_NON_SHARED_INC in flags and an empty migrate_disks in
params. Libvirt interprets this to be the default block migration
behaviour of "block migrate all writeable disks". However,
migrate_disks may only be empty because we filtered attached volumes
out of it, in which case libvirt will block migrate attached volumes.
This is a data corruptor.

This change addresses the issue at the point we call migrateToURI3().
As we never want the default block migration behaviour, we can safely
remove the flag if the list of disks to migrate is empty.

Change-Id: I9b545ca8aa6dd7b41ddea2d333190c9fbed19bc1
Resolves-bug: #1719362
(cherry picked from commit ea9bf5216be60fb3fa1704cf6257adca4e634cb1)

(cherry picked from commit ea9bf5216be60fb3fa1704cf6257adca4e634cb1)

commit_message:
libvirt: Don't VIR_MIGRATE_NON_SHARED_INC without migrate_disks

If we specify block migration, but there are no disks which actually
require block migration we call libvirt's migrateToURI3() with
VIR_MIGRATE_NON_SHARED_INC in flags and an empty migrate_disks in
params. Libvirt interprets this to be the default block migration
behaviour of "block migrate all writeable disks". However,
migrate_disks may only be empty because we filtered attached volumes
out of it, in which case libvirt will block migrate attached volumes.
This is a data corruptor.

This change addresses the issue at the point we call migrateToURI3().
As we never want the default block migration behaviour, we can safely
remove the flag if the list of disks to migrate is empty.

(cherry picked from commit ea9bf5216be60fb3fa1704cf6257adca4e634cb1)

nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py:
  Explicitly asserts byte string destination_xml in
  _test_live_migration_block_migration_flags. Not required in master
  due to change I85cd9a90.

(cherry picked from commit 2486f34ec49ffdf381912d7f0fd5199ce0dfa013)

Change-Id: I9b545ca8aa6dd7b41ddea2d333190c9fbed19bc1
Resolves-bug: #1719362

[{'created': '2018-02-18 22:13:07.000000000', 'message': "Replace virtualenv-tools by a script

virtualenv-tools has a bug which gets triggered in gates: it can't
change the shebang of a virtualenv python bin/ files if they
were generated with a virtualenv script whose shebang ends with
python2 instead of python.

Because we can't modify virtualenv-tools, we use shell scripts
instead.

Change-Id: I6cc40b4fc473df29c6e3d7844fde6340694d43bb
Partial-Bug: #1741634
"}]
commit_message:
Replace virtualenv-tools by a script

virtualenv-tools has a bug which gets triggered in gates: it can't
change the shebang of a virtualenv python bin/ files if they
were generated with a virtualenv script whose shebang ends with
python2 instead of python.

Because we can't modify virtualenv-tools, we use shell scripts
instead.

Change-Id: I6cc40b4fc473df29c6e3d7844fde6340694d43bb
Partial-Bug: #1741634

It is used for serialisation when sending the node to IPA during get_clean_steps().'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-02-22 10:33:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

> (1 comment)

There is fairly liberal usage of hasattr() in oslo_versionedobjects. Could be worth investigating.

I think this usage of obj_attr_is_set is ok. The problem we had was that the hasattr() in as_dict ended up calling the property getter [1] for the attribute. The actual attribute is stored on the object as '_obj_<field>', and the property getter checks for that. When it is not set, we get to obj_load_attr(), which fails [2]. We get a NotImplementedError raised by the property getter, and our original hasattr returns False.

With obj_attr_is_set(), the hasattr() is checking for '_obj_<field>', which isn't a property, so we're safe.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/oslo.versionedobjects/blob/7da2437b4b5f3cf8b766513022874dde78aa4e34/oslo_versionedobjects/base.py#L64
[2] https://github.com/openstack/oslo.versionedobjects/blob/7da2437b4b5f3cf8b766513022874dde78aa4e34/oslo_versionedobjects/base.py#L596"}, {'account_id': 14760, 'date': '2018-02-22 16:18:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

 > 
 > [1] https://github.com/openstack/oslo.versionedobjects/blob/7da2437b4b5f3cf8b766513022874dde78aa4e34/oslo_versionedobjects/base.py#L64
 > [2] https://github.com/openstack/oslo.versionedobjects/blob/7da2437b4b5f3cf8b766513022874dde78aa4e34/oslo_versionedobjects/base.py#L596

Thanks for explaining!"}, {'account_id': 19339, 'date': '2018-02-26 16:56:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

commit_message:
Support nested objects and object lists in as_dict

The value returned by ironic.objects.IronicObject.as_dict() should be a
plain object, in order for it to be serialised to JSON. Currently,
nested object fields and object list fields are not converted to dict
format. This caused problems during cleaning, when the node object's
as_dict representation is JSON encoded and sent to IPA.

This change adds support for calling as_dict() on nested objects and
list objects, to ensure these are also returned in dict form.

We also change the method used in as_dict() for checking whether an
object has an attribute. The hasattr() function used previously has
problems when used with properties in python 2 [1], in that any
exceptions raised in the property getter result in hasattr() returning
False. Instead we use obj_attr_is_set() to determine whether the object
has a particular attribute.

[1] https://hynek.me/articles/hasattr/

Change-Id: Ib2166040508827db28d6f6e2d9a3e655c16f2993
Closes-Bug: #1750027

commit_message:
Merge s3api func tests

Merge s3api tests back into swift's functional
test tree: test/functional.

Also:
- Skip if s3api is not enabled in the pipeline
- Fix some broken things at multipart upload since logging change
- Add in process func-s3api env to tox

Co-Authored-By: Kota Tsuyuzaki <tsuyuzaki.kota@lab.ntt.co.jp>
Change-Id: Idcb6a92bc203de1fe6868f73c72205258e2249a8

commit_message:
Don't print the start of a workflow, log it

The printing of the workflow execution makes things too verbose from
the CLI. That output intermixes with other output. We should just log
it at level DEBUG.

Change-Id: I11228582c948adfc90b4f1ddb172fabb87965660

commit_message:
Update noVNC deployment docs to mention non-US keymap fix in 1.0.0

noVNC 1.0.0 has the fix for non-US key mappings so this adds a simple
note when installing the novnc package that at least 1.0.0 should be
used for non-US key map support.

Change-Id: Ia1a84c986025f8a46c1062440faa0deb1d2d73a5
Related-Bug: #1682020

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-24 09:21:12.000000000', 'message': 'Restore support for percona packages when using ppc64le

In https://review.openstack.org/535252 the installation
process for the role was simplified, but an unintentional
side-effect was to removed the previously included support
for installing the extra percona packages when installing
on the ppc64le platform.

This patch re-introduces that ability, but scopes it to
only execute on that hardware platform, and only for Ubuntu.

The download is, by default, facilitated through the deploy
node (rather than the target nodes) so that the download
is done once, then pushed to the targets. This can be
adjusted with the right parameters to download from the
targets instead.

Also, in https://review.openstack.org/543888 adjustments
were made to disable compression/qpress on architectures
other than x86_64, and to fail the role execution if it
was enabled on any other architecture. This has been
corrected to ensure that compression is enabled by default
for ppc64le on Ubuntu, and enabled by default for x86_64,
but disabled by default for all other combinations. The
fail task is adjusted appropriately and moved to the main
task file so that it executes and fails out before any
changes are made.

Change-Id: I850a37b465a427a827e357111942973457fafa0d
(cherry picked from commit 1075fe411aa7b37e6c536e1c1ea5d4bfd509d2b0)
'}]
commit_message:
Restore support for percona packages when using ppc64le

In https://review.openstack.org/535252 the installation
process for the role was simplified, but an unintentional
side-effect was to removed the previously included support
for installing the extra percona packages when installing
on the ppc64le platform.

This patch re-introduces that ability, but scopes it to
only execute on that hardware platform, and only for Ubuntu.

The download is, by default, facilitated through the deploy
node (rather than the target nodes) so that the download
is done once, then pushed to the targets. This can be
adjusted with the right parameters to download from the
targets instead.

Also, in https://review.openstack.org/543888 adjustments
were made to disable compression/qpress on architectures
other than x86_64, and to fail the role execution if it
was enabled on any other architecture. This has been
corrected to ensure that compression is enabled by default
for ppc64le on Ubuntu, and enabled by default for x86_64,
but disabled by default for all other combinations. The
fail task is adjusted appropriately and moved to the main
task file so that it executes and fails out before any
changes are made.

Change-Id: I850a37b465a427a827e357111942973457fafa0d
(cherry picked from commit 1075fe411aa7b37e6c536e1c1ea5d4bfd509d2b0)

commit_message:
Remove neutron-managed firewall rules from /etc/sysconfig/iptables

See https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1541528

We don't want IPtables rules managed by Neutron to be persistent, it can
cause issues when rule are recreated while a namespace doesn't exist.
This patch makes sure that in any Neutron node, no IPtables rule will be
persistent if it contains "neutron-" in the name.

Change-Id: Ife465c2c6739c3cbfb9923ed97f370baa745739c
Related-Bug: #1747960
(cherry picked from commit 3c71c483e3e91d11fa83bfd751d2d8e54fdb4a20)

commit_message:
Add new Gnocchi scenarios

This patch is based on [1] and adds following scenarios:

GnocchiArchivePolicyRule.list_archive_policy_rule
GnocchiArchivePolicyRule.create_archive_policy_rule
GnocchiArchivePolicyRule.create_delete_archive_policy_rule

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/453861/

Change-Id: I3d2104fa6f6ba4bd90c4ac1771e48c32a5403832
Signed-off-by: Juha Kosonen <juha.kosonen@nokia.com>
